availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
24
The Governor approved an account of $4. to H. B. Frayser for publication of the Governors Proclamation ordering election in place of P. Hines of Warren County.
He pardoned Wm Stewart convicted of burglary by the Jefferson Circuit Court and sentenced to confinement in the Penitentiary for three years.
He respited for six months a Judgment of a Justice of the Peace for Trimble of $10. against Barney Williams for a breach of the peace
He respited for twelve months the following Judgments

row.cell: Carroll Cir. Ct. vs. Jno. King --

body.p: He remitted the following Judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Carroll Cir Ct. vs P. Hundley

body.p: He approved and signed an Enrolled Bill Chapter 2.
